intro: Stachytarpheta chamissonis var. brevibracteata, commonly known as the narrow-bract stachytarpheta, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, lanceolate leaves and showy, two-lipped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial to full sun. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink to purple in color, and it produces small, bract-like structures that give it its specific name. The species is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and floral display.
